oai_dc:dc.dc:title: C.C.C. workers on the ring and chow gong, C.C.C. Co. 417, Ivy, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rutherford, Charles E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For current rights information, please visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001200
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this photograph, Civilian Conservation Corps workers pose on the ring and chow gong at C.C.C. Company 417, in Ivy, Tennessee. On the back of the photograph, the people in photo are identified as Joe Givins, Calvin Robinson, Jack Pitts, Leo Decker, and Charles Rutherford. The dates are inferred from Charles Rutherford's promotion certificates.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.) -- People -- 1930-1940
Tennessee Valley Authority and "grass roots democracy" .
Government and Politics.
Wars and Military.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945).
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices, http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200600000001199
